title: Shooting & Finishing Challenge
description: How sharp is your shooting and finishing?

questions.question: What part of the foot is best for a powerful shot?
questions.explanation: The laces provide power and accuracy.

questions.question: When should you try to chip the goalkeeper?
options: When they rush out and leave goal open
questions.explanation: Chip when the keeper is off their line.

questions.question: What is 'placement' in finishing?
questions.explanation: Placing the ball makes it harder for the keeper to save.

questions.question: Which is the best body position when shooting?
questions.explanation: Staying over the ball keeps shots low and controlled.

questions.question: A 'first-time finish' means...
options: Shooting without controlling the ball first
questions.explanation: A first-time finish is quick and can catch keepers off guard.

questions.question: What is a volley?
options: Striking the ball before it hits the ground
questions.explanation: A volley is when you shoot an airborne ball.

questions.question: When shooting from distance, what helps accuracy?
options: Keeping head down and following through
questions.explanation: Good technique keeps shots on target.

questions.question: What is a 'poacherâ€™s goal'?
questions.explanation: Poachers score from rebounds and loose balls in the box.

questions.question: When should you use the inside of your foot to finish?
questions.explanation: Inside foot is best for picking out corners.

questions.question: What should you do after shooting?
questions.explanation: Always be ready for a second chance.

questions.question: A 'curled shot' is best for...
questions.explanation: Curled shots can beat keepers from angles.

questions.question: What is the main goal when finishing?
questions.explanation: The aim is to put the ball in the net.

questions.question: How do you disguise your shot?
questions.explanation: Disguising shots fools defenders and the keeper.

questions.question: What is a 'half-volley'?
options: Striking the ball just after it bounces
questions.explanation: A half-volley is hit just after the ball bounces.

questions.question: Why is composure important when finishing?
options: To stay calm and pick the right shot
questions.explanation: Composure leads to better decisions and more goals.
